q: Change is hard at first, messy in the middle and gorgeous at the end.
h:
“Change is hard at first, messy in the middle and gorgeous at the end.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Make yourself so useful to other people, that they think you are irreplaceable.
h:
“Make yourself so useful to other people, that they think you are irreplaceable.” —
Og Mandino

q: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
h:
“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Your imagination is your preview of life's coming attractions.
h:
“Your imagination is your preview of life's coming attractions.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Courage is the willingness to engage in a risk-taking behavior regardless of whether the consequences are unknown or possibly adverse.
h:
“Courage is the willingness to engage in a risk-taking behavior regardless of whether the consequences are unknown or possibly adverse.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Change is hardest at the beginning, messiest in the middle and best at the end.
h:
“Change is hardest at the beginning, messiest in the middle and best at the end.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Nothing is permanent in this wicked world - not even our troubles.
h:
“Nothing is permanent in this wicked world - not even our troubles.” —
Charlie Chaplin

q: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
h:
“Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.” —
Thomas Edison

q: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
h:
“There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.” —
Plato

q: The thing about smart people is that they seem like crazy people to dumb people.
h:
“The thing about smart people is that they seem like crazy people to dumb people.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: The more you take responsibility for your past and present, the more you are able to create the future you seek.
h:
“The more you take responsibility for your past and present, the more you are able to create the future you seek.” —
Celestine Chua

q: No man is happy who does not think himself so.
h:
“No man is happy who does not think himself so.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
h:
“Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.” —
A.A. Milne

q: Everything that irritates us about others.
h:
“Everything that irritates us about others.” —
Carl Jung

q: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
h:
“The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.
h:
“Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education.
h:
“Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
h:
“Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
h:
“Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: The primary point of this existence is to live, and all living things move and grow.
h:
“The primary point of this existence is to live, and all living things move and grow.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Don't take yourself too seriously, pretty soon you can find the humor in our everyday lives.
h:
“Don't take yourself too seriously, pretty soon you can find the humor in our everyday lives.” —
Betty White

q: The only people without problems are those in cemeteries.
h:
“The only people without problems are those in cemeteries.” —
Tony Robbins

q: We become what we believe.
h:
“We become what we believe.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Patience expands your options. If you insist on immediate gratification, your choices are severely limited.
h:
“Patience expands your options. If you insist on immediate gratification, your choices are severely limited.” —
Ralph Marston

q: It is easy to discover what another has discovered before.
h:
“It is easy to discover what another has discovered before.” —
Christopher Columbus

q: A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.
h:
“A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.” —
Charles Darwin

q: A simple rule in dealing with those who are hard to get along with is to remember that this person is striving to assert his superiority; and you must deal with him from that point of view.
h:
“A simple rule in dealing with those who are hard to get along with is to remember that this person is striving to assert his superiority; and you must deal with him from that point of view.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Troubles are often the tools by which God fashions us for better things.
h:
“Troubles are often the tools by which God fashions us for better things.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: We don't stumble accidentally into an amazing life. It takes decision, a commitment to consistently work on ourselves.
h:
“We don't stumble accidentally into an amazing life. It takes decision, a commitment to consistently work on ourselves.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: You have the freedom to be yourself, your true self, here and now, and nothing can stand in your way.
h:
“You have the freedom to be yourself, your true self, here and now, and nothing can stand in your way.” —
Richard Bach

q: If you truly expect something to be difficult, it will be.
h:
“If you truly expect something to be difficult, it will be.” —
Peter A. Cohen

q: Sometimes, the only way to evolve is to open ourselves fully.
h:
“Sometimes, the only way to evolve is to open ourselves fully.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.
h:
“My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.” —
Steve Jobs

q: The wise warrior avoids the battle.
h:
“The wise warrior avoids the battle.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Quiet people have the loudest minds.
h:
“Quiet people have the loudest minds.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Don't seek, don't search, don't ask, don't knock, don't demand - relax.
h:
“Don't seek, don't search, don't ask, don't knock, don't demand - relax.” —
Osho

q: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
h:
“You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do. ” —
Henry Ford

q: Who you are is defined by what you're willing to struggle for.
h:
“Who you are is defined by what you're willing to struggle for.” —
Mark Manson

q: Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.
h:
“Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
h:
“I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.” —
Thomas Edison

q: You can never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
h:
“You can never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.” —
Christopher Columbus

q: The number one cause of failure is the fear of failure.
h:
“The number one cause of failure is the fear of failure.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Forgive those who have hurt you.
h:
“Forgive those who have hurt you.” —
Les Brown

q: Love is merely the name for the desire and pursuit of the whole.
h:
“Love is merely the name for the desire and pursuit of the whole.” —
Aristophanes

q: Art is the signature of civilizations.
h:
“Art is the signature of civilizations. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: A very little key will open a very heavy door.
h:
“A very little key will open a very heavy door.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Being spiritual has nothing to do with what you believe and everything to do with your state of consciousness.
h:
“Being spiritual has nothing to do with what you believe and everything to do with your state of consciousness.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: If you can't fly, run. If you can't run, walk. If you can't walk, crawl, but by all means, keep moving.
h:
“If you can't fly, run. If you can't run, walk. If you can't walk, crawl, but by all means, keep moving.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Change is inevitable but personal growth is a choice.
h:
“Change is inevitable but personal growth is a choice.” —
Bob Proctor

q: Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.
h:
“Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.” —
Aristotle
